entries.meaning: A gravity-based device used to store and rotate round food and drink in a first-in-first-out manner.
examples: After collecting them each day from the chicken coop, she put the eggs in her skelter until she needed them.

verbs.description: skelter (third-person singular simple present skelters, present participle skeltering, simple past and past participle skeltered)

entries.meaning: (colloquial, with "away" or "off") To run off helter-skelter; to hurry; to scurry.
examples: It was evident that Europeans seldom came here, for numbers of women skeltered away as I walked through the village  [â€¦]
